title: Dale Abbey Walks

images.title: Garth Newton / Dale Abbey
images.caption: Dale Abbey. Little remains of St Mary's Abbey but the most striking is this arch that formed the east window. A Priory was founded here by Augustinian Canons from Calke Abbey about 1150 and about 50 years later an Abbey was established by Premonstratensian Canons which flourished until it became a victim of Henry VIII.

images.title: Andy Jamieson / All Saints, Dale
images.caption: All Saints, Dale. The church dates from the mid-12th century and at 26 by 25 feet, is probably one of the smallest churches in the country.

images.title: Graham Burnett / The Hermitage, Depedale
images.caption: The Hermitage, Depedale. Looking into Hermit's cave in Depedale, Hermitage Wood. A 12C Baker in Derby saw a vision in which he was told to leave his work and become a hermit in Depedale, here is the remaining result.

images.title: The Midshires Way near Hermit's Wood by Jonathan Clitheroe, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Midshires Way near Hermit's Wood

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Cat and Fiddle windmill and Mill House
images.caption: The Cat and Fiddle Mill is a post mill situated close to the village. It has a small round house and covered platform at the top of the ladder.

images.title: Stephen McKay / Dale Abbey
images.caption: Stone cottage in the village. The Village, as the name of the main village street is called, runs south from Moor Lane to end by the church and the access to the abbey remains. Cars are discouraged here because there is no turning space.

images.title: Sjwells53, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Friars House, 15th century in origin, with stone from the abbey on ground floor, right (north) side. Close studded timber frame to left.

images.title: The Carpenters Arms in Dale Abbey by Jonathan Clitheroe, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Carpenters Arms in Dale Abbey

description: This Derbyshire village includes the historic ruins of a 12th century abbey and some fine Peak District countryside. There's also several other listed buildings in the village including a 15th century Friar's cottage and a 300 year old pub for refreshment after your walk. This circular walk in Dale Abbey explores the site of the abbey and the adjacent Hermitage Woods where there are some peaceful woodland trails. On the way you will pass the 12th century All Saints church and the Hermit's cave - an ancient dwelling cut into the sandstone cliffs in the woods. Part of the walk uses a section of the Midshires Way. To extend the walk you could continue west along the trail and visit the woodland and lake at the 18th century Locko Park .
